messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Re: :-)
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, I did a search for him the other night got an education in Yurts. What I didn t find was why he feels about public schools the way he does. Any ideas?
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, I did a search for him the other night got an education in Yurts.
What I didn't find was why he feels about public schools the way he does.
Any ideas?



Sherri-Lee



_____

From: Valerie [mailto:valerie@...]
Sent: Saturday, August 07, 2004 12:43 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: :-)



http://www.motherearthnews.com/index.php?page=arc
<http://www.motherearthnews.com/index.php?page=arc&id=5327> &id=5327

Coperthwaite is one of my favorite author/yurt builders. Here's a
site from TMEN about him and his yurts. :-)

love, Valerie
www.ubpub.com

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] :-)
messages.msgSnippet: Oh this is so great, but who is William Coperthwaite? Sherri-Lee _____ From: Valerie [mailto:valerie@ubpub.com] Sent: Thursday, August 05, 2004 3:17 PM To:
messages.messageBody:
Oh this is so great, but who is William Coperthwaite?



Sherri-Lee



_____

From: Valerie [mailto:valerie@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 05, 2004 3:17 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] :-)



Most teaching is presumptuous assuming that one person knows what
another SHOULD know, is violent because it violates another person,
clutters the mind with unabsorbed trivia; is uneconomical, wasteful,
and destructive of our greatest wealth - human potential and
creativity; is paternalistic - developing dependent rather than free
and free-thinking people and is destructive of the teacher's
potential as well as that of the student.

William S Coperthwaite

messages.msgSnippet: Most teaching is presumptuous assuming that one person knows what another SHOULD know, is violent because it violates another person, clutters the mind with
messages.messageBody:
Most teaching is presumptuous assuming that one person knows what
another SHOULD know, is violent because it violates another person,
clutters the mind with unabsorbed trivia; is uneconomical, wasteful,
and destructive of our greatest wealth  human potential and
creativity; is paternalistic  developing dependent rather than free
and free-thinking people and is destructive of the teacher's
potential as well as that of the student.

William S Coperthwaite
